plugin.comment: While represented as an enum, it is actually an index to the "HUD Shaders" block in CHGD.
Only select "Use Parent Widget" for a Bitmap or Text Widget, otherwise the game will crash.
These will only function with the placement anchor value set to Grenade A/B/C/D.

Things to note about them: -Only 1 condition needs to match per flags for the game to count it. Split the flags between the parent and bitmap/text widgets to get around this. -Fields named with "Weapon" only resolve on HUDs referenced by weapons. -Fields named with [Special] mean the widget is always visible by default, but play a specific animation if a match occurs. -Fields named with [Brief] mean the widget is always invisible by default, but play a specific animation if a match occurs, then becomes invisible again. -Every other field should behave as an on/off switch for whether or not the widget should be drawn.
Can adjust the visible area of a widget if non-zero. Coordinates refer to the overall screen, so the top left corner is 0,0

tagblock.name: State Data

bit.name: First Person
bit.tooltip: Combine this with PDA active to have elements hide in third person without the PDA up

tagblock.comment: if any flags in the hidden state resolve to true then the widget stays active but becomes hidden not hidden state - this is backwards. During these states, all widgets are hidden UNLESS the state is checked.

tagblock.name: State Data

bit.name: Offset Sprite Index By Biped Type
Offset Sprite Index By Range Input

tagblock.name: Text Widgets
State Data

bit.name: First Person
bit.tooltip: Combine this with PDA active to have elements hide in third person without the PDA up

tagblock.comment: if any flags in the hidden state resolve to true then the widget stays active but becomes hidden not hidden state - this is backwards. During these states, all widgets are hidden UNLESS the state is checked.
Fonts use a dumb jump table that creates a custom font ordering for the HUD. The number in brackets is the proper engine order index from the fontpackage file.

This value can be anything from the hud_messages unicode tag, or one of the following, where a-f correspond to Output Scalars a-f in the Render Data block: chud_out_a chud_out_b chud_out_c chud_out_d chud_out_e chud_out_f chud_variant_name chud_talking_player_name chud_arming_meter_name chud_time_left chud_training_text chud_campaign_objective_text chud_survival_objective_text chud_achievement_progression_toast_name1 chud_achievement_progression_toast_name2 chud_achievement_progression_toast_name3 chud_achievement_progression_toast_name4 chud_achievement_progression_toast_name5
